comments:
I have migrated all my 3.1 plugins to 3.2 and the line coverage options is working. I am facing a problem while launching any application e.g. Eclipse runtime, junit test etc. I get the following error's in the logs

JRE used:  j2re1.4.2_10

Steps Carried out to get the bug:
            Imported all 3.1 plugins in Eclipse 3.2 and compiled them successfully. Opened test plugin and ran the junit test suite, the following errors are displayed in log. Similarly if i try to launch a new eclipse runtime i get the same errors.

It looks like you are running some 3.2 bundles on a version of org.eclipse.osgi from 3.1.  In 3.1 the Equinox framework (org.eclipse.osgi) did not properly verify the execution environment.  We fixed this in 3.2 and we also moved the verification of the execution environment to resolve time so that we do not prevent bundles from being installed when their execution environment does not match.

Please run with the -noExit -console options.  When it fails run the "ss" command at the osgi> prompt.  This will list the installed bundles in your environment.  Please post the output to this bug so we can evaluate what you have installed in your target.  Thanks.

Also one way to work around this is to launch the 3.1 Equinox framework with the VM argument

-Dorg.osgi.framework.executionenvironment="OSGi/Minimum-1.0,OSGi/Minimum-1.1,JRE-1.1,J2SE-1.2,J2SE-1.3,J2SE-1.4"

Output of the ss command

Framework is launched.

id	State       Bundle
0	ACTIVE      system.bundle_3.1.2
2	RESOLVED    org.eclipse.update.configurator_3.1.0
3	ACTIVE      org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.1.2

It looks like you are running the 3.1.2 equinox framework with a 3.2 configuration.  How did you import all the 3.1 plugins into 3.2?

If you want to target an eclipse 3.1 platform then I would recommend setting your target platform to an eclipse 3.1.2 installation.  You can do this at Window->Preferences->Plug-in Development->Target Platform.  Under Location select the eclipse directory where you extracted eclipse 3.1.2.  This should allow you to launch 3.1.2 eclipse from PDE in 3.2 eclipse.

Tom, just to be clear:
under what circumstances does a plug-in with an EE not run properly against a 3.1 framework?

See bug 141744 and bug 140955 for similar issues.

There are two things that changed in Eclipse 3.2 WRT execution environment verification ...

1) We moved the execution environment verification from the install process to the resolve process (bug 111333)

2) We set the list of supported execution environments according the the java profile selected in osgi (bug 108271).  Before we only set the execution environment to the currently running VM.  For example on a 1.4.2 VM we would set it to only J2SE-1.4.  It really should have been set to the complete set of EEs that a 1.4.2 VM supports (i.e. OSGi/Minimum-1.0,OSGi/Minimum-1.1,JRE-1.1,J2SE-1.2,J2SE-1.3,J2SE-1.4)

In 3.1 this results in installation failures when a bundle specifies an EE of J2SE-1.3 but the current VM is 1.4.2.  This is because we did not set the running EE to a complete set of supported EEs for 1.4.2 AND we did the EE verification check at install time.  The work around in 3.1 is to set the EE for the platform manually using the following configuration property for a 1.4.2 VM:

org.osgi.framework.executionenvironment="OSGi/Minimum-1.0,OSGi/Minimum-1.1,JRE-1.1,J2SE-1.2,J2SE-1.3,J2SE-1.4"
This worksforme.  Please reopen if you are still having problems and provide the information requested in comment 3.  Thanks.
